stories.text:
Seems I'm not alone in believing that software is fun, and should be fun as well (while not getting in the way of getting work done) [from https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30725843].

One example is the `Defaults insults` setting in `sudo` that will add a insult every time you get your password wrong. This has made me smile a couple of times when the insult is really good.

Is there other examples of software that insults you when you get something wrong/do something incorrect?

This list can serve a double-purpose: first as a recommendation list for us who like to get insulted for fun, and second as a list of software to avoid for the ones that don't like it.
stories.title: Ask HN: Software That Insults You?

stories.text:
My Macbook is a complete mess, and I’m often in strange situations when somone approaches my desk or during a meeting, because my desktop is unorganized with icons , there are constantly several windows open, and I was frequently chatting in the conference while on mute.

I needed a solution where I could tidy up the desktop icons by concealing them, or hide all windows except the one I was presently working on, or turn on or off the microphone with a single click without having to seek for it.

I've been searching through different tools to see if there's anything that could fix this problem. While I've found a few, many of them are pricey, so I figured why not build one myself.

Here is where Zen mode comes in, with a single click you can hide desktop icons, hide inactive windows, mute mic or speakers.

You can watch a quick intro to the tool here: https://youtu.be/wT2PdPg-RZo

You can download the mac app here: https://zen-mode.carrd.co/

Any feedback is highly appreciated. Thank you!
stories.title: Show HN: Zen Mode – Hide Everything. Mute Everything
